item.title: Web-Page Downloader/Saver
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[code]import java.io.;
import java.net.;

public class WebLoader
{
public static void main (String[] args) throws Exception
{
try
{
String pageAddr;
String websiteAddress;
String file;
String localFile;
if(args.length == 1)
{
pageAddr = args[0];
}
else
{
pageAddr = “http://www.google.com”;
}

        URL url = new URL(pageAddr); 
        websiteAddress = url.getHost(); 
        file = url.getFile(); 
        localFile = file; 
        if(file.length() == 0) 
        { 
            file = pageAddr; 
            localFile = "index.html"; 
        }                             
        Socket clientSocket = new Socket(websiteAddress, 80); 
        System.out.println("Socket opened to " + websiteAddress + "\n"); 
        BufferedReader inFromServer = new BufferedReader (new InputStreamReader(clientSocket.getInputStream())); 
         
        OutputStreamWriter outWriter = new OutputStreamWriter(clientSocket.getOutputStream()); 
         
        outWriter.write("GET " + file + " HTTP/1.0\r\n\n"); 
        outWriter.flush();             
         
        localFile = localFile.substring(localFile.lastIndexOf('/') + 1); 

        BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(localFile)); 

        boolean more = true; 
        String input; 
         
        while (more) 
        { 
            input = inFromServer.readLine(); 

            if (input == null)  
                more = false; 
            else 
            { 
                System.out.print("-"); 
                out.write(input); 
            }                     
        } 
         
        System.out.println("\nPage Saved successfully...\n"); 
        out.close(); 

        clientSocket.close(); 
    } 
    catch (IOException e) 
    { 
        System.out.println ("Error getting page " + e); 
    } 
}

} [/code]

Read full topic
